New Records: The White Sox tied the 1962 New York Mets for the most losses in one season with 39 wins and 120 losses after their win against the Angels.
Key Match Events: The White Sox won the game 7-0, scoring a season-high seven runs in one inning, and Chris Flexen pitched six solid innings.
The victory kept the Sox' losing streak at 120, matching the 1962 Mets' record, with three games remaining against the Tigers.
Pre-Game Insights: The team aimed to avoid setting a new all-time loss record, with the season-high seven-run inning and Flexen's pitching key to the win.
Post-Match Reflections: The team remained focused on avoiding history, with the victory keeping their season alive and hopes intact for the future.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was part of a series and the Sox' determination to avoid setting a record, adding to the significance of the win.
